job.job_description: Rockwell Automation is a global technology leader focused on helping the world’s manufacturers be more productive, sustainable, and agile. With more than 28,000 employees who make the world better every day, we know we have something special. Behind our customers - amazing companies that help feed the world, provide life-saving medicine on a global scale, and focus on clean water and green mobility - our people are energized problem solvers that take pride in how the work we do changes the world for the better.We welcome all makers, forward thinkers, and problem solvers who are looking for a place to do their best work. And if that’s you we would love to have you join us!Job DescriptionAs a Data Science Analyst, you will help our clients solve challenging business problems. You will gain experiences across the Consumer, Life Sciences, and Industrial High-Tech industries, and across a variety of consulting services. You will work with our team of consultants and gain experiential, hands-on learning to help develop a broad set of professional skills. You will report to the Consulting Capability Lead and the position is remote. Your Responsibilities: Consult with Fortune 1000 clients on digital innovation, strategy, product development, manufacturing, and broader supply chain optimization.Design and implement disruptive digital technologies like Internet of Things, Machine Learning, and Augmented Reality to help our clients innovate customer experiences and internal capabilities.Improve product development, innovation, manufacturing, and broader supply chain processes for clients.Deploy enterprise technologies like Product Lifecycle Management (PLM), Product Portfolio Management (PPM), Supply Chain Planning & Management (SCM) and Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) solutions.Advise clients on connecting the digital thread across the discover, create, make, and sell stages of a product's lifecycle.Contribute to the development of research and thoughtware on a wide array of topics on the leading edge of innovation.Take a leadership role in driving internal projects that improve the business, strengthen our community, and better our people.Be a communication bridge between the business and technical teams. The Essentials - You Will Have: Bachelor's Degree in Relevant FieldLegal authorization to work in the U.S. We will not sponsor individuals for employment visas, now or in the future, for this job opening.Willingness to travel up to 80% of the time The Preferred - You Might Also Have: Typically requires no previous professional experience.Degree in Business, Economics, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Supply Chain Management, Mechanical Engineering, or similarSuccessful analyzing of complex challenges and strategic resolution, demonstrated in previous educational or professional experienceSuccessful operational and project coordination, complying with project deadlinesSuccessful collaboration and audience engagement across multiple platformsCollaborative relationships, creativity, leadership, and team building abilities What We Offer: Health Insurance including Medical, Dental and Vision401kPaid Time offParental and Caregiver LeaveFlexible Work Schedule where you will work with your manager to enjoy a work schedule that can be flexible with your personal lifeTo learn more about our benefits package, please visit at www.raquickfind.com. At Rockwell Automation we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you're excited about this role but your experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right person for this or other roles. This position is part of a job family. Experience will be the determining factor for position level and compensation. #LI-Remote #LI-LifeAtRok #LI-JF1 For this role, the Base Salary Compensation is from $79,200 - $118,800 with an annual target bonus of 5% of base salary. Our benefits for the US can be found here. Actual pay will be based on factors such as skills, knowledge, education, and experience.We are an Equal Opportunity Employer including disability and veterans. If you are an individual with a disability and you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation during the application process, please contact our services team at +1 (844) 404-7247.

job.job_title: Research Scientist - AI-Mediated Reality and Interaction Research
job.job_description: NVIDIA Research’s "AI-Mediated Reality and Interaction" team is looking for a research scientist. Our mission is to create interactive physical AIs capable of operating in dynamic 4D worlds. We conduct fundamental research on the algorithms, theory and application of human-AI interaction and 4D world modeling using new ideas in artificial intelligence (AI), neural rendering, graphics, generative modeling, large language models, human behavior understanding and digital human creation. That research impacts many existing NVIDIA products, including Isaac, Omniverse, Metropolis, NuRec, XR, AI4Media, XR, and helps create new ones. We need a highly creative, independent and self-starting research scientist to help us invent that future. Come join a diverse research group that collaboratively works on hard and meaningful interdisciplinary problems with passion, drive and curiosity; that consistently publishes and demonstrates cutting-edge technology at top venues in computer vision, artificial intelligence and graphics; and that values real impact on NVIDIA products and the industry at large. What you’ll be doing:Propose, research, prototype and test innovative research ideas.Publish at top conferences and patent research ideas.Collaborate with other research team members, external researchers and mentor interns.Create working interactive demonstrations to showcase your research ideas.Participate in technology transfer with engineers around NVIDIA as ideas "graduate" from research to product.What we need to see:Ph.D. in Computer Science/Electrical Engineering or equivalent research experience.Outstanding research track record in top-tier conferences (CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, SIGGRAPH, NeurIPS, ICLR, etc.).Proficiency in theory and practice of AI and computer vision algorithms.Experience with 3D graphics development.Strong programming skills in Python, C++, CUDAProficiency with distributed deep learning training frameworks, e.g., PyTorch.Excellent communication skills.NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most resourceful and dedicated people in the world working for us. Are you creative and autonomous? Do you love the challenge of exploring and creating the techniques that will define our future products? If so, we want to hear from you! Your base salary will be determined based on your location, experience, and the pay of employees in similar positions. The base salary range is 160,000 USD - 258,750 USD.You will also be eligible for equity and benefits.Applications for this job will be accepted at least until December 19, 2025.NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

job.job_title: 2026 Fulltime - Raytheon Software Integration Engineer I
job.job_description: Date Posted:2025-12-15Country:United States of AmericaLocation:MA801: Marlborough, MA 1001 Boston Post Road Building 2, Marlborough, MA, 01752 USAPosition Role Type:OnsiteU.S. Citizen, U.S. Person, or Immigration Status Requirements: Active and transferable U.S. government issued security clearance is required prior to start date.​ U.S. citizenship is required, as only U.S. citizens are eligible for a security clearance​Security Clearance: DoD Clearance: SecretAt Raytheon, our mission is to protect and connect the world, and we achieve that through cutting edge technologies and a talented team of professionals. As part of Raytheon's Radar Software Integration Team, you will contribute directly to the development and integration of advanced radar systems that support critical defense and aerospace applications. Job SummaryThe Ground and Maritime Defense Radar Software department is seeking a highly motivated and skilled Radar Software Integration Engineer to join the Radar Digital Product Line Software Operations team. The ideal candidate will collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to deliver robust, high-performance radar software solutions. This role involves integrating, testing, and troubleshooting radar software to ensure optimal system performance in various operating environments. You will interact with downstream program stakeholders and tackle complex software integration issues across all products and programs supported by the Radar Digital Product Line. You will perform Tier 1 support and triage for software issues occurring at downstream test sites and will coordinate with in-plant subject matter experts to resolve these issues. You will deploy, install, and update radar software at downstream radar sites.What You Will DoAssist in software integration and testing under the guidance of senior engineers. Conduct basic software integration, system testing, and debugging in lab and field environments. Execute test plans, procedures, and scripts to validate radar software functionality and performance. Participate in Agile software development practices and contribute to smaller tasksAnalyze and resolve software/hardware interface issues during software integration. Document integration processes, test results, and troubleshooting steps to ensure knowledge transfer and system traceability. Learn and apply programming and scripting skills in a controlled setting.Acquire domain specific knowledge in areas such as signal processing, resource management, hardware/software integration procedures, or radar systemsSupport field installations and trials, as necessary, to ensure successful system deployment. Minimal travel (0-10%) for training or introductory field experience.Qualifications You Must HaveBachelor’s degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.Basic knowledge of high-level programming languages such as C++ or Java. Basic knowledge of scripting languages such as Python, Perl, or bash.Basic familiarity with Linux and the command line interface.Basic familiarity with version control systems like Git or Rational Clearcase.This position requires 12 months or less of professional experience (excluding internships).U.S. citizenship and the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance.Qualifications We PreferDemonstrated problem-solving skills and ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.Experience with build systems such as CmakeFamiliarity with software debugging and troubleshooting tools (e.g. gdb, Wireshark, tcpdump).What We Offer Our values drive our actions, behaviors, and performance with a vision for a safer, more connected world. At RTX we value: Safety, Trust, Respect, Accountability, Collaboration, and Innovation. Learn More & Apply Now! Please consider the following role type definition as you apply for this role.Location: Marlborough, MA or Tewksbury, MAOnsite: Employees who are working in Onsite roles will work primarily onsite. This includes all production and maintenance employees, as they are essential to the development of our products. This position requires a security clearance. DCSA Consolidated Adjudication Services (DCSA CAS), an agency of the Department of Defense, handles and adjudicates the security clearance process. More information about Security Clearances can be found on the US Department of State government website here:https://www.state.gov/m/ds/clearances/c10978.htmRTX Corporation is an Aerospace and Defense company that provides advanced systems and services for commercial, military and government customers worldwide. It comprises three industry-leading businesses – Collins Aerospace Systems, Pratt & Whitney, and Raytheon. Its 185,000 employees enable the company to operate at the edge of known science as they imagine and deliver solutions that push the boundaries in quantum physics, electric propulsion, directed energy, hypersonics, avionics and cybersecurity. The company, formed in 2020 through...

Basic knowledge of scripting languages such as Python, Perl, or bash.Basic familiarity with Linux and the command line interface.Basic familiarity with version control systems like Git or Rational Clearcase.This position requires 12 months or less of professional experience (excluding internships).U.S. citizenship and the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance.Qualifications We PreferDemonstrated problem-solving skills and ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.Experience with build systems such as CmakeFamiliarity with software debugging and troubleshooting tools (e.g. gdb, Wireshark, tcpdump).What We Offer Our values drive our actions, behaviors, and performance with a vision for a safer, more connected world. At RTX we value: Safety, Trust, Respect, Accountability, Collaboration, and Innovation. Learn More & Apply Now! Please consider the following role type definition as you apply for this role.Location: Marlborough, MA or Tewksbury, MAOnsite: Employees who are working in Onsite roles will work primarily onsite. This includes all production and maintenance employees, as they are essential to the development of our products. This position requires a security clearance. DCSA Consolidated Adjudication Services (DCSA CAS), an agency of the Department of Defense, handles and adjudicates the security clearance process. More information about Security Clearances can be found on the US Department of State government website here:https://www.state.gov/m/ds/clearances/c10978.htmRTX Corporation is an Aerospace and Defense company that provides advanced systems and services for commercial, military and government customers worldwide. It comprises three industry-leading businesses – Collins Aerospace Systems, Pratt & Whitney, and Raytheon. Its 185,000 employees enable the company to operate at the edge of known science as they imagine and deliver solutions that push the boundaries in quantum physics, electric propulsion, directed energy, hypersonics, avionics and cybersecurity. The company, formed in 2020 through the combination of Raytheon Company and the United Technologies Corporation aerospace businesses, is headquartered in Arlington, VA.The following position is to join our RTX Corporate, Enterprise Services, Research Center or BBN team:What We Offer:Whether you’re just starting out on your career journey or are an experienced professional, we offer a robust total rewards package with compensation; healthcare, wellness, retirement and work/life benefits; career development and recognition programs. Some of the benefits we offer include parental (including paternal) leave, flexible work schedules, achievement awards, educational assistance and child/adult backup care.As part of our commitment to maintaining a secure hiring process, candidates may be asked to attend select steps of the interview process in-person at one of our office locations, regardless of whether the role is designated as on-site, hybrid or remote.The salary range for this role is 55,000 USD - 107,000 USD. The salary range provided is a good faith estimate representative of all experience levels. RTX considers several factors when extending an offer, including but not limited to, the role, function and associated responsibilities, a candidate’s work experience, location, education/training, and key skills.Hired applicants may be eligible for benefits, including but not limited to, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short-term disability, long-term disability, 401(k) match, flexible spending accounts, flexible work schedules, employee assistance program, Employee Scholar Program, parental leave, paid time off, and holidays. Specific benefits are dependent upon the specific business unit as well as whether or not the position is covered by a collective-bargaining agreement.Hired applicants may be eligible for annual short-term and/or long-term incentive compensation programs depending on the level of the position and whether or not it is covered by a collective-bargaining agreement. Payments under these annual programs are not guaranteed and are dependent upon a variety of factors including, but not limited to, individual performance, business unit performance, and/or the company’s performance.This role is a U.S.-based role. If the successful candidate resides in a U.S. territory, the appropriate pay structure and benefits will apply.RTX anticipates the application window closing approximately 40 days from the date the notice was posted. However, factors such as candidate flow and business necessity may require RTX to shorten or extend the application window.RTX is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or veteran status, or any other applicable state or federal protected class. RTX provides affirmative action in employment for qualified Individuals with a Disability and Protected Veterans in compliance with Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act and the Vietnam Era Veterans’ Readjustment Assistance Act. Privacy Policy and Terms:Click on this link to read the Policy and Terms

job.job_description: Anything Anything is the AI product engineer for the next wave of entrepreneurs. It's an AI agent that turns English into apps. Everything you need make money on the internet built in - mobile, web, design, AI, backend, infra, payments. Launched Aug 7th. https://x.com/anything Hit $5m rev and growing quickly Try it at anything.com Role What this role is This role is for people who want to grow faster than they could anywhere else. You will work on real AI systems from day one and take ownership of meaningful product work. You will tackle challenging problems, learn new tools constantly, and operate in an environment where speed, ambition, and personal growth are core expectations. You will be supported by senior engineers but trusted to figure things out, push through ambiguity, and build systems that reach millions of users. This is a place for people who want to develop world class skills early in their career. You will be expected to move fast with clarity–reasoning through tradeoffs, writing things down when helpful, and choosing solutions that fit the broader system. How you will operate Break down complex or unclear problems into clear steps and propose practical solutions Make thoughtful tradeoffs between speed, correctness, and long-term maintainability Build AI powered features using TypeScript and modern AI frameworks Collaborate closely with product and design to align on goals and ship with confidence Talk with users and use the product yourself to understand real-world needs and opportunities Push through obstacles with resourcefulness and a strong problem-solving mindset Learn new concepts quickly and apply them to real production challenges Stay up to date on the latest in AI research and engineering Take on tasks that stretch your abilities and work hard to close skill gaps quickly Contribute to a culture of ownership, ambition, and fast-paced learning AI is a rapidly evolving field, and no one here has all the answers. We value humility, openness to feedback, and a willingness to revise your thinking as you learn. Strong opinions are welcome when they are paired with curiosity and respect for evidence. Primary outcomes Your success will be measured by: 1. Independent problem-solving and execution You take goals, investigate unknowns, evaluate options, and deliver solutions without waiting for extensive guidance. 2. Fast skill growth You significantly expand your technical range within your first months through hands-on work and deliberate learning. 3. Shipped product impact Your features improve user experience, performance, and product depth in measurable and well-reasoned ways Required background Candidates typically show: A strong technical foundation from a top CS program or equivalent hands-on experience building real systems Evidence of ambitious, self-driven projects or internships that required problem solving and ownership Solid programming fundamentals and comfort with TypeScript Exceptional ability to read deeply, reason clearly, and communicate complex ideas Curiosity about AI systems and a desire to push beyond easy or obvious solutions A personal track record of learning quickly and putting in real effort to master difficult skills Experience working in fast-paced environments while balancing care with urgency. Nice to have Prior internships in AI, backend, or infrastructure engineering Previously been one of the first 10 hires at startup Personal projects that show initiative, creativity, and independent thinking Backgrounds or interests that span technical and non-technical domains (e.g. writing, design, philosophy, economics, etc) Why this role matters We are building products on the frontier of AI and that requires a team that learns fast, thinks clearly, and works hard. You will grow more in one year here than in several years at a typical company. You will take on challenges that stretch your abilities and solve problems that materially shape the future of the product. In all roles We look for: Intense . Ship fast. Cycles are hours, not weeks. Hard to outwork. Ownership . Grab the #1 priority and relentless to deliver. Fearlessness . Risk on. Do the unknown / uncomfortable. Say "good" to bad news. Taste . Obsess over quality. Know what “great” looks like. No slop. Play . Curiosity, joy, and energy. Sound like you? Come do the most meaningful work of your career. Applying Submit here and we'll reach out if it's a fit. Note: we get 100s of low quality AI generated applications daily. We do want to meet you if you're excellent and really care. If you want to stand out, after you submit, send resume + a short note to marcus@anything.com w/ subject line "\[Role\] | Your Name" (bullets work!)
